questions.text: Does the organization have a documented and approved Information Security Policy?
questions.help_text: The policy should be documented, approved by management, and communicated to all employees.

questions.text: Is the Information Security Policy reviewed and updated at least annually?
questions.help_text: Regular review ensures the policy remains current with organizational changes and threat landscape.

questions.text: Are all employees and contractors required to acknowledge the Information Security Policy?
questions.help_text: Acknowledgment ensures awareness and commitment to security policies.

questions.text: Is there a formal user access provisioning and de-provisioning process?
questions.help_text: Process should include approval workflows for granting and revoking access.

questions.text: Are user access rights reviewed at least quarterly?
questions.help_text: Regular reviews help identify and remove unnecessary access privileges.

questions.text: Is multi-factor authentication (MFA) implemented for privileged accounts?
questions.help_text: MFA adds an additional layer of security for sensitive accounts.

questions.text: Are password policies enforced (complexity, expiration, reuse)?
questions.help_text: Strong password policies reduce the risk of unauthorized access.

questions.text: Are firewalls deployed and configured to protect the network perimeter?
questions.help_text: Firewalls should be configured with deny-all rules and specific allow rules.

questions.text: Is network segmentation implemented to isolate critical systems?
questions.help_text: Segmentation limits the impact of security breaches.

questions.text: Are intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS) deployed?
questions.help_text: IDS/IPS help detect and prevent malicious network activity.

questions.text: Is network traffic monitored and logged for security events?
questions.help_text: Monitoring helps identify potential security incidents.

questions.text: Is sensitive data encrypted at rest and in transit?
questions.help_text: Encryption protects data from unauthorized access.

questions.text: Are regular backups performed for critical data?
questions.help_text: Backups ensure data availability in case of failure or incident.

questions.text: Are backup restoration procedures tested at least quarterly?
questions.help_text: Testing ensures backups are functional when needed.

questions.text: Is there a data classification policy in place?
questions.help_text: Classification helps apply appropriate security controls.

questions.text: Is there a documented incident response plan?
questions.help_text: The plan should define roles, procedures, and escalation paths.

questions.text: Are security incidents logged and tracked?
questions.help_text: Tracking helps identify patterns and improve security posture.

questions.text: Is the incident response plan tested at least annually?
questions.help_text: Testing ensures the plan is effective and team members are prepared.

questions.text: Is there a documented Business Continuity Plan (BCP)?
questions.help_text: BCP ensures critical operations can continue during disruptions.

questions.text: Is the BCP tested at least annually?
questions.help_text: Testing validates the plan's effectiveness.

questions.text: Are Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO) defined for critical systems?
questions.help_text: RTO and RPO help prioritize recovery efforts.
